description: Triangle T(n,k): T(n,k)=1 if GCD(n,k) = 1, T(n,k)=0 otherwise (n >= 1, 1 <= k <= n).
comments: Row sums = phi(n), A000010: (1, 1, 2, 2, 4, 2, 6, ...). - _Gary W. Adamson_, May 20 2007Characteristic function of A169581: a(A169581(n))=1; a(A169582(n))=0. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 02 2009The function T(n,k) = T(k,n) is defined for k>n but only the values for 1<=k<=n as a triangular array are listed here.T(n,k) = |K(n-k|k)| where K(i|j) is the Kronecker symbol. - _Peter Luschny_, Aug 05 2012Twice the sum over the antidiagonals, starting with entry a(n-1,1), for n >= 3, is the same as the row n sum (i.e., phi(n): 2*Sum_{k=1..floor(n/2)} T(n-k,k) = phi(n), n >= 3). - _Wolfdieter Lang_, Apr 26 2013
